name: Byte The Bullet
description:
Get into my infected computer and restore every virus-ridden system by recovering game attributes like color or save functions. Explore correlated worlds in a non-linear campaign that test your skills specifically:
  • Hard Disk Device: Memory
  • Video Card: Sight
  • Sound Card: Hearing and Rhythm
  • Power Supply: Visual sharpness
  • Cooling System: Measurement

Features:
  • Explore the computer systems and complete them in order to restore game attributes, reduce hazards and activate new world benefits.
  • Blast and dash your way through enemies and obstacles with your Jump-Pack to free the guardians stationed at the end of each system.
  • Unlock new powers by completing systems or finding hidden blocks and use them later collecting bitcoins.
  • Discover secrets using the binary code to help open up new areas on your adventure and relive old memories in cameo levels.

Gameplay:
  • Use your weapon wisely. Holding button increases its temperature lowering fire rating and expanding firing arc.
  • Use your Jump Pack while jumping to reach high places, dash or dodge hazards.
  • Collect bitcoins to increase your health and activate new powers.



Byte the Bullet is in part a parody of multiple classic games. Several 80s & 90s are spoofed, and the game is primarily based in classic 2d platform games like Rockman(1987) or Super Mario Land 2(1992). Some games like Prince of Persia (1989), Doom (1993), Alley Cat (1983) were also parodied in some Levels.

Atmosphere:
Huntdown all the curious viruses that you meet through this infected computer.

  • Minimalist pixel art graphics
  • 80’s style themed
  • Small gags plenty of sarcasm and humor
  • Incredible Music by David Fesliyan and Sound FXs by Juhani Junkala
